title: Gallery Talk: Reading Egyptian Art
hero_caption: <p>Egypt, <em>Wall Fragment from the Tomb of Amenemhet and His Wife Hemet</em>, Middle Kingdom, Dynasty 12 (1976-1794 BC). Museum Purchase Fund.</p>
description:
Elizabeth McIlvaine Assistant Curator Ashley Arico, museum educator Lucas Livingston, and Ancient and Byzantine Art department technician Eric Warner bring out a work of art from storage for a pop-up discussion of the wonderful interplay between word and image in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs.
